Draw line 5 from point (0.4687, 0.375) to point (0.0, 0.375). 9. Draw line 6 from point (0.0, 0.375) to point (0.0, 0.0) to close the loop. 10. Scale the sketch using a factor of 0.75. 11. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation angles from the coordinate system and the specified translation vector. 12. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.375 units. The dimensions of part 1 are length: 0.75, width: 0.375, height: 0.75. Part 2: Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0, 0.0938, 0.375]. 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create face 1 in the sketch and draw loop 1 on it. 4. Within loop 1, draw line 1 from point (0.0, 0.0) to point (0.4687, 0.0). 5. Draw line 2 from point (0.4687, 0.0) to point (0.4687, 0.1875). 6. Draw line 3 from point (0.4687, 0.1875) to point (0.0, 0.1875). 7. Draw line 4 from point (0.0, 0.1875) to point (0.0, 0.0) to close the loop. 8. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.4687. 9. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the rotation angles from the coordinate system and the specified translation vector. 10. Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Z-axis by 0.0938 units using the "CutFeatureOperation" boolean operation. The dimensions of part 2 are length: 0.4688, width: 0.4688, height: 0.0938.</description>
